wikipedia_page.main:
William Ritchie (11 September 1936 – 11 March 2016) was a Scottish professional footballer who was best known for his time with Rangers.
Ritchie started his career at local side Bathgate Thistle before moving to Rangers in 1955. He played both legs of Rangers 1961 European Cup Winners' Cup Final defeat to Fiorentina.
He left Rangers in 1967 and joined Partick Thistle. Ritchie died on 11 March 2016, aged 79.
